July 6, 1986: Fiction
LAST OF THE BREED, by Louis L'Amour. (Bantam, $17.95.) The adventures of a
United States Air Force major in Siberia.
THE BOURNE SUPREMACY, by Robert Ludlum. (Random House, $19.95.) The
hero of ''The Bourne Identity'' foils a plot to seize Hong Kong.
ACT OF WILL, by Barbara Taylor Bradford. (Doubleday, $17.95.) Three
generations of talented, ambitious women in England and New York.
A PERFECT SPY, by John le Carr√©. (Knopf, $18.95.) The tale of Magnus Pym, a
British secret agent, and his father, Rick, a flamboyant con man.
THE EIGHTH COMMANDMENT, by Lawrence Sanders. (Putnam, $18.95.) The
theft of a priceless Greek coin reveals a New York dynasty's scandals.
THE GARDEN OF EDEN, by Ernest Hemingway. (Scribners, $18.95.) A writer and
his wife have affairs with the same woman on their honeymoon.
I'LL TAKE MANHATTAN, by Judith Krantz. (Crown, $18.95.) Rich, beautiful Maxi
Amberville conquers the world of magazine publishing.
TAMING A SEA-HORSE, by Robert B. Parker. (Seymour Lawrence/Delacorte,
$15.95.) The private eye Spenser tracks a young woman through the seamy
byways of a pleasure empire.
LAKE WOBEGON DAYS, by Garrison Keillor. (Viking, $17.95.) Yarns about life in
a small Minnesota town.
GONE WITH THE WIND, by Margaret Mitchell. (Macmillan, $16.95). A facsimile of
the original 1936 edition of the Civil War saga.
THE GOOD MOTHER, by Sue Miller. (Harper & Row, $17.95.) A woman's
attachment to her daughter becomes a consuming passion.
BARRIER ISLAND, by John D. MacDonald. (Knopf, $16.95.) One man sets out to
thwart a multimillion-dollar Mississippi land swindle.
THE MAMMOTH HUNTERS, by Jean M. Auel. (Crown, $19.95.) Ayla continues
her adventures in the prehistoric world.
LIE DOWN WITH LIONS, by Ken Follett. (Morrow, $18.95.) An Englishwoman
caught between the C.I.A. and the K.G.B. in Afghanistan.
A MATTER OF HONOR, by Jeffrey Archer. (Linden/Simon & Schuster, $18.95.) A
family secret that could change the course of the cold war.
July 6, 1986
Non-Fiction
FATHERHOOD, by Bill Cosby. (Dolphin/ Doubleday, $14.95.) Anecdotes and
ruminations from the television star and father of five.
YOU'RE ONLY OLD ONCE! by Dr. Seuss. (Random House, $9.95.) A checkup at
the Golden Years Clinic in pictures and rhyme; the first Dr. Seuss book for adults.
JAMES HERRIOT'S DOG STORIES, by James Herriot. (St. Martin's, $19.95.)
Fifty tales by a Yorkshire veterinarian about his favorite animal.
FORD: The Men and the Machine, by Robert Lacey. (Little, Brown, $24.95.) A
history of the automobile company and the dynasty founded by Henry Ford.
THE TRIUMPH OF POLITICS, by David A. Stockman. (Harper & Row, $21.95.)
Why President Reagan was unable to balance the budget.
ROCK HUDSON: His Story, by Rock Hudson and Sara Davidson. (Morrow,
$16.95.) An account of the actor's public and private life written with his
cooperation.
''AND SO IT GOES,'' by Linda Ellerbee. (Putnam, $16.95.) Television journalism
as experienced by an NBC correspondent.
NECESSARY LOSSES, by Judith Viorst. (Simon & Schuster, $17.95.) Life is a
series of losses, the author argues, and we must confront them to grow.
YEAGER: An Autobiography, by Chuck Yeager and Leo Janos. (Bantam, $17.95.)
The story of the first man to fly faster than sound.
WHEN ALL YOU'VE EVER WANTED ISN'T ENOUGH, by Harold S. Kushner.
(Summit, $16.95.) A rabbi discusses ''the search for a life that matters.''
ENTER TALKING, by Joan Rivers with Richard Meryman. (Delacorte, $17.95.)
The talk-show hostess' long professional climb.
IACOCCA: An Autobiography, by Lee Iacocca with William Novak. (Bantam,
$19.95.) The rise of an immigrants' son to top jobs at Ford and Chrysler.
BUS 9 TO PARADISE, by Leo Buscaglia. (Slack/ Morrow, $16.95.) Another trip
with the ebullient advocate of the virtues of love.
IN SEARCH OF THE TROJAN WAR, by Michael Wood. (Facts on File, $22.95.)
Archeologists' search for the truth behind the Homeric legend; tie-in to a PBS
series.
THE MAN WHO MISTOOK HIS WIFE FOR A HAT, by Oliver Sacks. (Summit,
$15.95.) The loss of the faculty of recognition and other strange neurological
disabilities.
